review.itemreviewed: WarmCube Active Alt HB 1/2-Zip Pullover - Men's
review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Excellent design and warmth.  Fits like a glove!  Love the color.
review.name: Fantastic Midweight Jacket

review.itemreviewed: WarmCube Active Alt HB 1/2-Zip Pullover - Men's
review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Excellent puffy, perfect for Alpine climbing!  Currently using it as a layer while riding my e-bike and works great!  Warmth at the core and arms are free with wind breaker.
review.name: Superb Puffy!

review.itemreviewed: WarmCube Active Alt HB 1/2-Zip Pullover - Men's
review.reviewBody: I'd say solid 3.5 if I could give that rating.  I consider this more of a sweatshirt or a shacket.  Lighter weight than I had hoped for and at full price.  I have it in orange and get a lot of compliments on it, however.  The sleeves are not insulated/down like the body of the garment however they are two layers with the inner layer being similar to a mesh jersey material.  I would say it is true to size in all aspects but the fit is a tad narrow through the chest (pit to pit) and with no stretch to the fabric getting it on and off over your head is a bit challenging.  Biggest disappointment is the side zip pockets in that the zippers constantly get jammed and snagged.  Overall it's good but felt it wasn't worth its full price.
review.name: Good but not Great
comment:
Hello there

Thank you for providing us with a feedback on our products. We truly appreciate you bringing the matter to our attention. I am very sorry to hear that the item has not met your expectations. We will make sure to forward your idea and feedback to an appropriate department, so that we may think about an appropriate solution for the future. Thank you so much for sharing your opinion with us.


If you have any more questions, please reach out to us via https://www.marmot.com/support/contact-us or through LiveChat. We’re available Mon-Fri, 9AM - 5PM EST

Thank you,
Marmot Consumer Care

review.itemreviewed: WarmCube Active Alt HB 1/2-Zip Pullover - Men's
review.reviewBody: The collar started to pill just from the first wear. This is far too expensive to be such poor quality. I saw a review that mentioned this but I dismissed it. Save your money. Learn from me. This product is a blow to marmots reputation.
review.name: Material shows wear immediately
comment:
Thank you for providing us with feedback on our product. We truly appreciate you bringing the matter to our attention.

We are very sorry to hear that you are experiencing some issues with our product. In order to get a repair assessment or advice, please fill out a Warranty Claim on our website under:

https://www.marmot.com/warranty-repair.html

If you have any more questions, please reach out to us via https://www.marmot.com/support/contact-us or through LiveChat. We’re available Mon-Fri, 9AM - 5PM EST

Thank you,
Marmot Consumer Care

review.itemreviewed: WarmCube Active Alt HB 1/2-Zip Pullover - Men's
review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] At first sight this jacket appeared to be a light spring or fall jacket, but once you give it a try you quickly find out it is surprisingly efficient at retaining heat and keeping you warm in any weather. The design is a bit different with the cube pattern, but it looks nice and adds a bit of flash to the jacket. The jacket is a pullover design which I usually am not a fan of but with the lightness of the jacket it didn't bother me too much. The material has a nice high quality feel that is a bit rugged to the touch but still very nice. The zippers are very high quality and feel stronger than any I have seen before. I love that the jacket is about the same weight as a hooded sweatshirt which allows you to be very active and mobile in it while keeping you warm in the worst of weather. This is a great jacket that I highly recommend. It is a bit pricey so be prepared for that but it does not disappoint.
review.name: So Light and Warm

review.itemreviewed: WarmCube Active Alt HB 1/2-Zip Pullover - Men's
review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] The Men's WarmCube™ Active Alt HB 1/2-Zip is fantastic. It strikes the right balance between warmth and breathability. I appreciate how it allows easy movement for my arms and upper body. No need to constantly adjust layers – it adapts well to different activities. Comfortable, practical, and a solid choice for a day outdoors.
review.name: Great jacket

review.itemreviewed: WarmCube Active Alt HB 1/2-Zip Pullover - Men's
review.reviewBody:
[This review was collected as part of a promotion.] As an active dad who lives in Montana, I need a 1/2-zip that can keep up with me. I need something that is warm, comfortable, and breathable, and that can handle a variety of weather conditions. The Marmot - Men's WarmCube checks all of those boxes.

I've been wearing the WarmCube for a few months now, and I'm really impressed with it. It's made with Marmot's proprietary insulation, which is incredibly warm and lightweight. It also has a moisture-wicking finish, so I stay dry and comfortable even when I'm working hard.

I've worn the WarmCube for everything from hiking and skiing to running errands and playing with my kids. It's perfect for all of my activities, and it's kept me warm and comfortable in all kinds of weather.
highly recommend
review.name: five stars!

review.itemreviewed: WarmCube Active Alt HB 1/2-Zip Pullover - Men's
review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I received this product about a week or 2 ago and I gave it to my son to wear for school. He absolutely loves the jacket it is nice and warm and extremely comfortable to wear. It is made out of a very strong material and it also is a little waterproof. I highly recommend this  Jacket To anyoneTo anyone who wants a nice jacket for their kids or for themselves
review.name: Nice product

review.itemreviewed: WarmCube Active Alt HB 1/2-Zip Pullover - Men's
review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Im not sure whether to call this a sweater or a jacket but whatever it is, its super comfortable and surprisingly warm. Its very airy and compactly fluffy which is what makes it comfy and warm. I had to buy a size smaller than normal so it fits a little snug but it seems true to size.
review.name: Super comfy and warm

review.itemreviewed: WarmCube Active Alt HB 1/2-Zip Pullover - Men's
review.reviewBody:
[This review was collected as part of a promotion.] This jacket is very well made and keeps the Marmot brand true to its promise.  It is very warm.  Great for those late fall and early winter weather as well.  I am 5'7" and 160 lbs.  This jacket fits me very well. it does not bulk up like others.  Feels good and is very fitted.  The length is perfect.  not too long. It is good for walking and even running in.  very well made.
Has lots of pockets for your gear if you are into some extreme winter sports and you need it.  I got medium and it works perfect for my body type.  it has a bit of stretch material so good fit and good comfort overall.

Highly recommend.
review.name: Great fitting and very comfy and warm

name: WarmCube Active Alt HB 1/2-Zip Pullover - Men's

review.reviewBody:
Overall a great jacket! A little pricey compared to its peers but if price isn’t a dealbreaker I recommend.
Can stuff it into its own pocket for compact travel.
Works great for cold fall hiking days. Have not yet but plan to bring skiing with a shell layer over it (won’t use as a rain or snow jacket)

review.reviewBody: Dries quickly, it's super light, and crams into some pretty tight places without ruining the hat. The bungee cord cinch does a nice job at keeping the hat on your head in the wind without having a crazy tight strap. The vents do their job well, and it comes out of the washing machine as good as new every time. I'll be keeping an eye out for more color ways in the future.
review.name: Quick Drying & Light

review.reviewBody: I’ve been hunting for the perfect 5 panel and finally found it. I have a slightly large head and the Provo fits so comfy! It’s super light washable breathable looks good! I couldn’t ask for more from a cap. It’s so nice to be able to just give the elastic a tug when the wind picks up to help keep it on my head.
review.name: The ultimate summer cap

review.reviewBody: Love this hat. Super lightweight but feels durable and very well made. Great features, love the sweat brim. Washable and floats too, it’s ready for any adventure! Get it.
review.name: Excellent active hat

name: Provo 5-Panel Hat

review.reviewBody:
A little confused, a little satisfied, a little let down…everything is there and everything was in perfect bags for each section: wipers, damper, air spring. I just worked on the air spring tonight and it was going fine until I came across the silver air spring seal head. The replacement was like double the gauge of the shaft and obviously wouldn’t work. I ended up swapping o-rings from between the old and the new head to at least replace something since it was all there. 

The part that I’m perplexed by is that I did my research and knew I had a zeb ultimate with debonair. Found that in the drop down and bought it. Now, looking back, in my order where it would say “/debonair” it says “/dual position” 

I don’t know why that wasn’t apartment before, but if you look at the options now “/dual position” isn’t available either and a I swear I didn’t choose that at the time of the purchase. 

The rest of the parts seem fine, but that one detail of a fairly important piece to the bike is pretty disappointing on the clarity of the product. If you’re looking to buy this to keep up your zeb ultimate, beware that you might get sent the wrong air spring seal head. 

I don’t have pictures because it’s all already buttoned up, but again, inner diameter of the silver air spring seal head was too large and would not fit snug around air spring shaft.
review.name: Dual position? Debonair?

name: 200 Hour Fork Service Kit

review.reviewBody: Had been using Conti 4000/5000, but replaced during Covid with one of these because Conti was out of tires.  Just removed today on the front - over 10000 miles (probably had longer to run, but saw some small cuts and figured it's had a good life).  Road feel is similar to Contis - maybe a bit less sticky but not bad.
review.name: Last forever

review.reviewBody: Surprisingly grippy compound but still fast and light.
review.name: Sticky tire

review.reviewBody: I just changed out a Rubino Pro Graphine 2.0 that came on the bike. 4000 plus miles had no punctures and am very pleased with the performance of these tires. I did have trouble getting it to mount on the Hunt disc wheels I have, so I mounted it on another wheel(non disc) which was not a problem put it out in the sun and gave it another go. It still was going to give me a hard time getting it on the wheel. So, as I sat there pondering how I'm getting this tire on, I decided to use a hair dryer while I had it about 7/8th mounted it worked out and it's on. Beaded up perfectly. I guess just a few mms difference in tire or wheel size gave me a hard time getting it mounted.
review.name: Good Results

review.reviewBody: When I bought my carbon Bianchi the bike has cheap Vittorias on it. First ride I got a flat. After I switched to Serfas tires I had only one flat in 6 years. After not finding Serfas tires I went with the Rubios. First ride I got a flat.
review.name: Disappointed in Vittoria tires

name: Rubino Pro G2.0 Clincher Tire

review.itemreviewed: Renegade GTX Mid Wide Boot - Men's
review.reviewBody: I bought the 10 wide, which is what I usually get.  They were a tiny bit big for me, but I was planning a multi-month trek and anticipated my feet swelling a bit.  There was no real break-in period, they were comfortable from the beginning.  I got Superfeet trekking insoles to replace the stock ones, which worked well.  However, after only about 6 weeks of hiking the seams on both sides of the toe split open leaving gaping holes that allowed dirt and water in very easily.  I was out of the country and couldn't return for a warranty right away.  I ended up getting them sewn by a shoe repair guy, and  so far his job has held up better than the original construction.  My girlfriend got the women's 8 wide of the same model and the same thing happened to her, so I think it is just bad design to begin with.  It is disappointing because otherwise they are very comfortable boots.
review.name: Big on comfort, weak on durability

review.itemreviewed: Renegade GTX Mid Wide Boot - Men's
review.reviewBody:
I bought these online because these were the only place I could find Wide.   Unfortunately, after wearing them twice my toes were blistered from being cramped in the toe box.   My podiatrist told me that they are too narrow.   

I'm told Backcoutry only accepts returns for never worn boots. Now I'm looking for someone who needs a pair of only slightly used boots.
review.name: Wide is still too narrow

review.itemreviewed: Renegade GTX Mid Wide Boot - Men's
review.reviewBody: Was very pleased with the boot initially. I am a relatively casual hiker and within a year the stitching along the seams started coming out, so now they are impossible to weatherproof. The leather is still in good condition and the soles are holding up nicely several years in. I am very disappointed, by this critical flaw.
review.name: Stitching does not hold up

name: Renegade GTX Mid Wide Boot - Men's

description: Buy the Sea To Summit Ultra-Sil Kitchen Sink online or shop all Hike & Camp from Backcountry.com.

hasVariant.name: Ultra-Sil Kitchen Sink
hasVariant.description: Buy the Sea To Summit Ultra-Sil Kitchen Sink online or shop all Hike & Camp from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] We mainly use this for washing dishes (as you have to dump biodegradable soap away from water sources) but my partner also uses it to wash her hair when camping. Great little sink!
review.name: Great multi-use sink!

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Packs up tiny and very lightweight, but to do that, you’re sacrificing some sort of barrier protection and walls. We used it as a dish-washing tub on a recent camping trip, and it didn’t feel completely dry under the spot we’d use it, and it was a bit tricky to use, like washing dishes in a balloon. BUT, all that said, it did the job. So if you don’t mind sacrificing a bit to save weight, this could be a good purchase.
review.name: Does the job for minimal weight

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] My favorite Ultralite sink. Packs small and retains water for filtering and washing !!!!
review.name: My favorite Ultralite sink. Packs

review.reviewBody: More stable for holding water upright than the cylinder model. Dual purpose!
review.name: More stable for holding water

review.reviewBody: I purchased this sink for group camping trips - either summer trips or winter trips to backcountry huts for skiiing where there’s rarely a sink or other option for cleaning dishes, cups, etc. I did a test at home in my kitchen sink. It’s easy to set up this sink and to fold it up to store it back in its case. However, as others have mentioned, you must fill this sink up at least with a liter or two of water for it to work. Also, this sink does tend to spread out more than I’d prefer - I.e., you get a large shallow disc shaped sink. Still for the size and weight this seems like a decent solution for my groups.
review.name: Compact, lightweight, but not a perfect solution

review.reviewBody: Amazing. Light weight and works well. We used this on the Maah daah hey trail and it was great to have a bath and do laundry at the end of the day!
review.name: Amazing. Light weight and works

review.reviewBody: The kitchen sink is great for cleaning up when you have lots of dishes. A wide mouth that's stabilized makes all the difference. You need to have it reasonably full to get the stability though.
review.name: Gamechanger for cleaning with big groups

review.reviewBody: Purchased because is seemed like a little great sink for show weekend trip, Unfortunately seams are no great and leaks thru it.
review.name: No great... leaks

review.reviewBody: This sink is great it packs down to next to nothing and fits a ridiculous amount of water in it! I would recommend it to anyone who is either backpacking or short on space. This will absolutely make things easier for you when cleaning up at camp.
review.name: This sink is great it

review.reviewBody: This is not what I really expected to receive and in my opinion it is too flimsy to really be all that useful, despite the tiny size and ultra-light weight for backpacking. I took it on my last camping trip and found it marginally useful and flimsy. I am not pleased with this product nor the quite expensive price for it.
review.name: Not impressed

review.itemreviewed: Karuna Cord Wide Leg Pant - Women's
review.reviewBody:
I had high hopes for these pants due to their stylish wide-leg cut, corduroy fabric perfect for fall, and elevated casual vibe. Unfortunately, I had significant issues with the sizing. I initially ordered a size 6, which was much too large in both the waist and hips. Hoping for a better fit, I exchanged them for a size 4. While the smaller size was a slight improvement in the hips, the waist was still quite large, making the overall fit less than ideal.

The fabric and style are lovely, and I can see the potential in these pants for someone whose proportions align with the sizing. However, the inconsistency in fit was disappointing and ultimately led to my decision to return them. If you’re considering these pants, you may want to size down or be prepared for some alterations.
review.name: Lovely Fall Corduroys, Sizing Needs Work

review.itemreviewed: Karuna Cord Wide Leg Pant - Women's
review.reviewBody: I ordered two pairs of toad & co pants according to the size chart. These cords hit more like a mid-rise pant, and the waistband was way too big. I am typically size 4 in pants and 27 in jean, so I went with the 4. They fit fine otherwise, but the waist was gapping intensely. Meanwhile the size 4 balsam seeded cutoff pant fit as expected, no gapping, with a slightly higher rise. I was disappointed because these were well made and comfortable. For reference I am 5’4”, 135 lbs. I’ll be returning because I’m not sure that the elastic waistband style could be taken in for a better fit.
review.name: Odd fit

name: Karuna Cord Wide Leg Pant - Women's

review.reviewBody:
My riding jacket has seen better days and it was time to start looking for a replacement.  For quality made products, I always look to TLD.  I wear a size XL and all of my TLD jerseys have run true to size.  When I saw this jacket's discounted price, I didn't hesitate at making its purchase.

When the jacket arrived, I immediately tried it on.  Well, this XL was sized more like a M! I was able to get my arms in the sleeves.  However, I was unable to zipper up the front since it was nearly 4-6 inches short of my chest.  Unfortunately, I placed the jacket back in the original packing and returned it.  

Like my title says, it's possible the jacket I received was mis-labeled.  As I said, all my TLD jerseys fit true to size.  The jacket I received was the exception.  Aside from that, the jacket appeared well made and the seams were flawless.  Consequently my replacement jacket search continues.
review.name: Nice Jacket but Wrong Sizing?

name: Descent Jacket - Men's

review.reviewBody:
I found the Shimano sizing chart recommends one size larger than my usual fit. The sizing chart slotted me into a 47 based on my US size 12. I’ve always fit Euro size 46 (except Sidi size 46.5) so I measured my foot according to Shimano’s method on their web site. I measured 29 cm, a size 46 which they reference as size 11-11.5 US.

The RX8 fit perfectly from the first time I slipped them on. The TPU lugs deliver a solid, non-slip grip on any surface you walk on. The sole is very stiff and as promised, efficiently deliver power to the pedals. My pedals are Shimano XT and the lugs on the RX8 are designed to fit the platform perfectly. I find this integrated fit prevents cleat noise I’ve experienced with other shoes and delivers a super clean clip-in.

The single ratchet BOA Li2 dial is flawless and quick to adjust. I appreciate the dual strap design that simplifies removing the shoes.

These shoes are very light and comfortable, I even use them for road rides these days. Great as Cyclocross shoes in dry conditions only as they don’t have toe spike capability.
review.name: Great Fit, Excellent Quality

review.reviewBody:
Riding now for 30+ years, these are some of the most comfortable mtb shoes with stiff soles I’ve ever owned. 

They are narrow so if you have a wide foot I wouldn’t recommend. On the positive side the arch support system is great. It comes with two inserts, medium and large, can be used without for low arch and you could easily have custom sizes made. 

Having ridden over 1500 miles in 30+ mile increments, these stand up for superior comfort and performance. 

A ridged sole in a cushy glove for your feet.
review.name: Stiff, Comfortable, Powerful

name: RX801 Mountain Bike Shoe - Men's

review.reviewBody:
I'll confess, I board more often than I ski, but these puppies float very well!
Any wider and you'd have issue turning and skinning, but these are the perfect balance of float, but still quite light and maneuverable even in spite of me getting a longer length.

The skins that I got with them could have had slightly more bite and stickiness, but the skis themselves are rad. 
I also tested them inbounds and they work well on almost all terrain. They work best, logically, in those favorite powder stashes and keep speed very well.

I probably could have sized up - but like a snug fit so decided to go with the 27 
I'm a pretty athletic build and all my measurements are pretty spot on to the measurements on the size chart besides my hips - which are a little bigger - the shorts are stretchy so there is room to move. 
The cut-off design is definitely more noticeable after wash and wear - ending up with a pretty distressed-cut off look 
Mostly casual use for me, but would also wear for enough for any active day outside hiking or biking! 
Love the material and and durability. Big fan !
review.name: Fun, and FUNctional

review.reviewBody: I love these shorts except for the fact the button was not correctly snapped together and broke after a month. Backcountry offered a free return and a refund since they were out of stock. I just ended up declining and replacing the button because I really like the shorts and they are out of stock everywhere. It’s disappointing to spend almost $80 on a pair of shorts then have to fix them yourself after a month.
review.name: Button broke after a month.

name: Cut Off Jorts - Women's

review.reviewBody: I work outside, and this 1/4 zip is my go to when the temp drops. I think I have 5 of them now... one for every day!

review.reviewBody: I've been a long time user of UA Base. This new technology is absolutely the best yet. Haven't gotten into really frigid temps yet but in High 20's and low 30's it was more than adequate.

review.reviewBody: Purchased a Large. The fit & feel is nice. Only issue is it maybe a little too tight in forearms (if you like to roll-up your sleeves).

hasVariant.name: Wawona XL Ground Tarp
hasVariant.description: Buy the The North Face Wawona XL Ground Tarp online or shop all Hike & Camp from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: Perfect fit .... seems like it's a supply issue, only available online in limited supply however
review.name: Limited Supply of this must have

review.reviewBody: It does not fit my Wawona 6 person tent and there is no ground tarp that North Face currently carries that will fit my 6 person North Face tent.
review.name: Wawona 6 person - no ground tarps that fit

review.reviewBody: I'm not sure what the intent of this product is. It really only covers the open part of the XL tent as a floor mat and well if not carefully placed it will catch water in rain. I may be using it incorrectly hence the Two. But I can't really see the value in this. Two small to cover tent or the front area. It's basically an overpriced tarp Again maybe it's just me. However I do love the 6person Wanona tent.
review.name: Not sure the purpose of this product.

review.reviewBody: This is a great all around tarp. After getting the first one I've bought a second one. Works great to protect my leather seats in my Tahoe from the dogs. I got the second on to use as a ground tarp for ski/snowboard season to keep the feet dry when changing in parking lot and also got clips to connect together for a awning for shade in the summer. Very durable material and you'll always find another reason to use!
review.name: This is my 2nd one

review.reviewBody: Great size, especially when I don't feel like or need to grab my Yeti Wetland Blanket. It's lighter and cheaper too. Works very well as a park table barrier.
review.name: Perfect Size

review.reviewBody: Nice tarp but I was under the impression that it was a ground tarp big enough to go under the wawona 6. Turns out it is only big enough to cover a portion of the vestibule area. Which is nice, but as far as I can tell there is no tarp big enough to go underneath.
review.name: Nice tarp but...

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Excellent all around multi purpose tarp. Use it mostly to protect the leather seats in my Tahoe while the dogs are with me.
review.name: Excellent Multi Purpose Tarp

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] The ground tarp covered just the area of the vestibule and that worked out great
review.name: Good enough.

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Great ground tarp to layout you pack on, or to to sit and lay on. Very durable, easy to fold up and store as well.
review.name: Durable and convenient

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] incredible quality.. so happy to add to my camping gear
review.name: Amazing

review.reviewBody:
This is a very expensive cage that works perfectly.  I’ve got these on my road, gravel and mtb.   The main reason I spent the money is they will NEVER loose a bottle.  I’ve taken big spills and the bottle is still there.  I’ve plunged down gnarly class V roads on my gravel bike and the bottle is still there.  
  They are lightweight and good looking too, but it’s the bottle retention that is key.
  I’ve never had a problem with them mounting wrong either .  All 10 of them have been perfect.
review.name: Expensive perfection

review.reviewBody:
Great product but my account is hacked and Backcountry does nothing to fix it. Reached out to BBB.
All my info goes to a hacked email. They will not allow you to close your account.
review.name: Hacked account
comment: We understand your concern about your account security. We take these matters seriously and have sent you an email with further details.

review.reviewBody: Be very careful about these EXPENSIVE cages!!! Holes were drilled wrong bottle leans to the right!!!!
review.name: Caution Holes Drilled Offset

review.reviewBody:
I've been crushing new Tour de Commute PRs since buying two of these. The (psychological) gains of dope cages (that no one else sees) is significant. In my testing, the Matte is 4.7% more efficient than the Oil Slick variations. This is likely caused by them not properly complimenting my Canyon frame, therefore reducing said psych gains. 


Alright- with the caveat that my previous Mandibles set were stolen, along with my bike, these have stood years of use and my new set looks exactly the same. Are they *really* necessary for any of us? Def not. Do they work? Sometimes a little too well but then, when bombing down the ridiculously pot-riddled tarmac that are Seattle  streets or single track in the foothills, my bottles don't rattle like my teeth and I  know they aren't going to fly off.
review.name: Necessary? Nope. Awesome? Yep!
comment: Does it fit the newer Black Canyon bottles(Camel)?

name: Mandible Water Bottle Cage

review.reviewBody: The Salomon Cherry Tomato/Dragon Fire Cross 4 pack is a stylish, comfortable, and durable pack, perfect for short runs and hikes, but could use more back ventilation.
review.name: Would Recommend !

review.reviewBody: I think it fits pretty well with my body. I need to wear them for a long run. But I didn't know that it didn't come with the soft water flask. it's just coming with the backpack only.
review.name: Good Design!

review.reviewBody: The vest is nice and light and I love the pouches. But, I ran a half this past weekend and about halfway through, the vest was irritating my collar bone area. By the end of the race I ended up with some serious chafing that looks like a burn. Ouch! Could use some extra padding on the straps.
review.name: Light but some serious chafing
comment: Hi. For any inconvenience, we apologize. We're happy to reassure you that a case has been opened to address your worries, and we're looking forward to hearing from you. Check your inbox!

review.reviewBody: I completed a 16 mile run in the, and it was like it was not there. Although it does not come with flasks, if you already have some, or another brand and are looking for an inexpensive hydration vest option, this is a fine choice. It has a large pocket in the back for a bladder and a sleeve pouch for other items. You may want to be strategic in how you pack because things will bounce around back there. My only issue is that it would raise in the back and I would have to reach back there and pull it down. Maybe some weight back there would solve the issue.
review.name: Good entry to hydration vests

review.reviewBody: I love that this vest can support either bottles or a bladder (or both!).  I also like the 'just enough' pockets for phone, keys, bandaids without causing added weight.  Perfect for a mid-distance runner!
review.name: Light and Plenty of Storage

name: Cross 4L Hydration Pack

review.reviewBody: These shoes LOOK amazing but function poorly. It seems like a lot of the other reviews that have 1-3 stars have to do with the sizing being too narrow. review.reviewBody: I got the air pump that pumps quickly with high flow and all of the tools in case I need it. Hopefully, I will not  need it.  The price is a bit steep for all of it, and the quality craftmanship is worth it.
review.name: Great Tool for in case of an emergency!

review.reviewBody:
Been running this bad boy along with the EDC pump for about a year now. Opted to tap the steerer tube on my Ripmo AF to store the tool there, and it's been nothing but great. Everything you need for trailside (or garage) repairs and maintenance. Never forget your tools!

The tool also stores inside the pump, so for a gravel or road ride, just pop the tool out of the steerer tube and stick it in the pump, which mounts to any frame with water bottle bosses.

Grab the EDC plug plier kit and have any tubeless or chain repairs covered as well.

If you're interested in putting the EDC on your bike, reach out to a Gearhead and we'll help you get what you need (we can also install it all for you on a new bike!).

#BackcountryGearhead #CompetitiveCyclistGearhead

review.itemreviewed: Button Up Shirt - Past Season - Men's
review.reviewBody: I've had this shirt for a month and every time I wear it I get complimented.  The shirt itself fits a size larger than advertised (I'm normally XXL and bought the XL).  The pattern is loud and awesome.  The fabric is breathable and perfect for summer sends and BBQ's.  I'm a big fan of obnoxious button ups to outshine the other dads at the grill, I hope Stoic continues this trend!
review.name: Love It

review.itemreviewed: Button Up Shirt - Past Season - Men's
review.reviewBody: Just got this shirt and already love it. The functionality and attention to detail are unmatched, from the breathable and durable cotton ripstop to the 3 in 1 chest pocket this shirt has quickly become my go-to for car camping and outdoor concerts. The endless compliments on the fun mushroom print also don't hurt.
review.name: Impressive attention to detail

review.itemreviewed: Button Up Shirt - Past Season - Men's
review.reviewBody: I bought this as a gift and they love the shirt! It has a great relaxed fit, and the cotton rip stop makes it durable enough to wear casually and for all summer outdoor occasions. My favorite component of this shirt (aside from the fun mushroom print) is the chest pocket which has a Velcro pocket, a zippered pocket, and a smaller half pockets, all in one without being too bulky.
review.name: Friend LOVES it!

review.itemreviewed: Button Up Shirt - Past Season - Men's
review.reviewBody: This shirt has me excited for summer BBQs and PBRs. The lightweight Ripstop fabric is perfect for this loose fit style.  Throw on some flip flops and board short and you've got a party!
review.name: Party Shirt

review.itemreviewed: Button Up Shirt - Past Season - Men's
review.reviewBody: I wore the mushroom print shirt this past weekend at a cookout. The stretch material was comfortable and breathable. I got so many compliments, it's now my go to summer shirt.
review.name: I got so many compliments!

review.itemreviewed: Button Up Shirt - Past Season - Men's
review.reviewBody: The mushroom pattern makes for the coolest looking shirt ever! But it runs at least a full size large. I typically wear a medium, but needed a size small of this to fit how I like. The fabric is also a little scratchy, not so much it's a problem or uncomfortable but I certainly would not describe it as silky or smooth.
review.name: Awesome pattern, run very big!

review.itemreviewed: Button Up Shirt - Past Season - Men's
review.reviewBody: I ordered the mushroom shirt. It was a really poor quality feeling cloth and the shirt was massive. I didn't even bother trying to shrink it because it was so oversized. The fit was also really boxy and an uncomfortable material.
review.name: Pretty terrible

review.itemreviewed: Button Up Shirt - Past Season - Men's
review.reviewBody: Love this button down! I got the mushroom print, size medium (I am 6'2"). The shirt fit perfectly, refer to the size chart and model pictures for the right size. The material is lightweight and breathable - ideal for doing activities with style and not having to worry about sweating. The chest pocket has 3 separate compartments ideal for storing items separately. Super functional button down great for a night out or a trip to the mountains!
review.name: Breathable material and Multi-functional

review.itemreviewed: MXZ304 Wide Mountain Bike Shoe - Men's
review.reviewBody: I've been using the Lake boot for 4-5 years. Having Reynaud's makes it a requirement. I wear a size 44.5 EU in my regular bike shoe and went to 45 for my present boot of 5 years. That was a bit tight so i gambled and went up to a 46 and it was perfect. This is a great boot and I expect that it will last me another 5 years, or longer.
review.name: Awesome Boot

review.itemreviewed: MXZ304 Wide Mountain Bike Shoe - Men's
review.reviewBody: My extremities run cold normally - hands and feet - which has always had a negative impact on my ability to enjoy winter sports in CO.  I would still partake, but I would be miserable half the time because of the cold.  These Lake shoes have changed that to a level I never thought possible.  Yes, I still wear two pairs of socks, but my feet now stay warm the entire time I ride.  Rode for 3 hours the other night in 20 degree temps and my feet could've gone another 3 hours if my legs weren't dead. If you struggle with cold feet and need a solution, I highly recommend these bad boys. They are comfortable, warm & dry, easy to get on/off, and the Boa system allows me to tighten/loosen them for a perfect fit. Definitely order one size up so you can wear thick socks and still move your toes around.
review.name: Saved my ability to ride in the winter
comment: Just curious, what kind/type of socks did you wear with these shoes? I wore Rapha merino socks with these shoes and my toes started getting cold after 10 miles ride. The temp. was at 25 F. I will try heavier socks...

review.itemreviewed: MXZ304 Wide Mountain Bike Shoe - Men's
review.reviewBody: Rode in F 33/34° snowy weather. Snow melted and roads were wet. Shoe started soaking through about 20 minutes and feet wet after an hour. The tongue is NOT gusseted; ONLY attached/sewn at base. Water leaked through under flap, around the tongue. Deeply disappointed- have no idea why tongue would not be gusseted. Boots soaked through on a second ride with snow and wet roads at 30 ° F. Had bibs OVER boot top to keep water from running down legs into boots. Warm in 27° F and dry conditions. Have ordered another pair of boots for cold AND wet conditions.
review.name: NOT for wet conditions
comment:
Joseph I...
Good review. Can I ask what you 'ordered' that would work for both cold AND wet conditions?
Thanks!

review.itemreviewed: MXZ304 Wide Mountain Bike Shoe - Men's
review.reviewBody:
I love these boots.  Super comfortable, easy to get it with Boa system.
I rode in sub zero temps and my feet stay warm.
Most definitely recommend them.

Since they run true to size, I bought a size up to wear with heavy socks
review.name: Awesome boots

review.itemreviewed: MXZ304 Wide Mountain Bike Shoe - Men's
review.reviewBody: I have been riding in the winter for a couple of years now. I have used shoe covers and/or toe covers for my road shoes. They are okay for me down to about 40 degrees. However, below that, it would get a little cold even with using electrical tape to cover cooling vents and chemical warmers. A friend told me an older model of these boots "transformed" his winter riding experience. I bought these new ones, and completely agree. I can use them even as warm as the 40s and be super comfortable. I bought a half size up and got the wide version for my wide feet (my other shoes are not available in wide). I am not a fan of the flap that covers the boa laces in terms of getting in and out of the boots, but it probably helps with keeping out the wind and snow. The boots look large, but are surprisingly light-weight. Feels like maybe 1.5 times the weight of my PEARL iZUMi X-Project P.R.O. shoes, which are very light mtb shoes. The minimal added weight is completely worth it unless maybe if you are in an actual race.
review.name: Worth the money

name: MXZ304 Wide Mountain Bike Shoe - Men's

review.reviewBody: Been riding for several years and finally upgraded to this bike. Arrived set up as tubeless from Backcountry, and minimal set up to finish putting it together. Handling is great, and with the lower pressures on the NEXT tires it’s been very comfortable on the roads. So far no creaking on the seat post or BB thankfully. The black paint is much prettier in person as well!

Professional Build, thanks guys this is the 2nd Cervelo I ordered from you and won't be the last.

review.reviewBody: Bought this item for a multi-day backpacking trip through the Porcupine Mountains.  It doesn't offer enough spark to light anything.  If it actually worked it would be a cool item.  It was small and lightweight but failed when needed.
review.name: Waste of money.  Don't buy

review.reviewBody: Turned on gas placed the ignition lighter and pressed twice nothing. Kept the gas on and keep pressing moving the lighter over the mesh surface. Nothing. No warm food for that night. Purchased a lighter as soon as I found civilisation.
review.name: Purchased new for use with a new windjammer stove - didn't work!

review.reviewBody: Easier to carry than matches. Sparks well in all weather.
review.name: Light weight

review.reviewBody:
Bought this for some self supported hiking trips, but after 2 uses a day for 5 days it stopped working.

Luckily my friend had a flint which worked perfectly.

I can’t recommend this device as a reliable source of gas ignition.
review.name: Failed after 5 days and 10 uses

review.reviewBody: I purchased this product in Korea. It has a very simple design and excellent performance. However, I initially thought I could use it in the reactor, but I was a little disappointed when it didn't work. Fortunately, my cousin had a burner, so I was able to light it. Nonetheless, I remain confident in MSR, which consistently produces great products.
review.name: Great for backpacking

review.reviewBody: This ignitor worked about twenty times then failed. Lucky I had matches as a backup. I do not recommend this product.

review.name: Love them

review.reviewBody: I purchased this for my Europe trip unfortunately, I was able to wear it only one day because it was digging into the side of my foot by my ankles.  I only noticed it after wearing it for a day.  I’m not able to return it because it is worn.  Anyways, will never purchase any shoes again from any website that doesn’t honor returns if uncomfortable.

comment: We are very sorry to hear these were uncomfortable for you.  We do offer returns on used gear and will email you the information.  If we can help with any any questions please reach out to our customer service team.

review.reviewBody: The most comfortable shoe Keen makes, by far. Out of the box, immediate comfort. I have them in every color Keen has produced, lt gray, blue, dark gray, red, tan and sea something (dark turquoise green). Have bought Keen shoes for years, Keen is making a big mistake in reducing this style to three colors.
review.name: Produce all colors again. It is your best hiking

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Best part of this shoe for me is that it is waterproof! It feels like a sneaker, but acts like a low-rise hiking/walking shoe.

review.reviewBody:
Keens always fit me perfectly 
My favorite shoe brand

review.reviewBody: Comfortable out of the box. They are great for walking on uneven ground for me. They keep my foot stable and me upright. I do miss my old NXIS shoes from last year though. I can’t find them anywhere. They were more comfortable for walks on pavement. Bottom line is you can’t go wrong with Keens.

review.reviewBody: Taking these walking shoes to Ireland! They are very comfortable and not bad looking at all.

review.reviewBody: I bought this shoe for work and play. I'm on my feet for over 10hrs. This shoe not only looks great, it has the amazing KEEN footed! Love this shoe

description: Buy the KUHL Kanvus Jean - Men's online or shop all Clothing from Backcountry.com.

hasVariant.name: Kanvus Jean - Men's
hasVariant.description: Buy the KUHL Kanvus Jean - Men's online or shop all Clothing from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: Everything about these pants are great... except for the fact that I can't wear them. I'm 5'9 175 with "hockey legs" so buying pants isn't always easy for me. However, I wear a 33x30 in other Kuhl pants as well as many other brands like LL Bean, Levi, Free Fly and Prana without issues. The 33x30s I ordered were comically small to the point where I didn't bother to try to button them. Definitely do not buy these pants off Backcountry as you'll have to pay to return them when they don't fit.
review.name: Sizing is terrible

review.reviewBody: Have had 2 pairs. Both have color spots and fades after first wash. Snap does not stay closed. Both pairs were marked the same size, second pair is a size smaller on waist and length. I like Kuhl products but the Kanvus pants and poor quality.
review.name: Poor quality.

review.reviewBody: I love these Kanvus pants and I was trying to replace a pair that I have worn out but the sizing is terribly  inconsistent. The Size 38 waist I received measured 39.75" and the legs were extremely baggy, nothing like my current Kanvus pants.  They don't even come close to fitting.  Other reviewers say that the product sizing runs small, in my case the sizing was very large.  I don't how to adjust for that, could be big, could be small.
review.name: Love Kanvus pants but sizing way off!

review.reviewBody: As others have written below, the sizing is a mystery. I have a dozen pair of Kuhl pants, mostly Ryders. I expected these to be a bit slimmer fitting but was surprised by how much. Could not get them past my quads and when I finally pulled up the sausage skin pants, they have a very short rise?you would have to be a eunuch to wear these.
review.name: Astoundingly inaccurate sizing

review.reviewBody: I have a couple other pair of these and they were good.  Bought a pair in a different color, same size, same part number etc and they were too big. So returned them.  It seems to me that sizing is getting very inconsistent with about all brands so what to do?  I used to buy them at a brick-and-mortar store so I could try them on, It would be less of an issue if all freight was free.
review.name: Not great this time

review.reviewBody: Great fit. Very functional pant that could be worn for any occasion. Material is light but tough.
review.name: Great fit

name: Kanvus Jean - Men's

review.reviewBody: The material on these tights is odd and not very stretchy. If you have any muscle or thicker thighs or hips these will be a chore to get on. Once I got them on the waist was way too big and all the extra seems were awkward and rub in weird places. I returned these and would not consider another purchase from LG. The brand quality has declined over the years and there are much better products out there.
review.name: Weird material

review.reviewBody:
Why can't cycling clothing companies offer petite sizing in long tights/capris?!?

The main issue is that the area where the knees are articulated slide down because my femurs are short, which can cause discomfort after a while. It's a constant game of hoisting them up during a ride in order to avoid that happening. 

That said, they did a great job at wind protection and keeping my legs warm during my ride, so that was redeeming!
review.name: A little long for someone 5'2"

review.reviewBody: These tights are dynamite!   As a florida girl I needed something for those colder northern temps.   They kept me warm on a 38 degree day.  Never felt the wind, even when we were enjoying the downhills.  They are soft, almost cuddly.  Fit perfectly.   I washed them in a laundry bag, cold water, gentle and they came out as if professionally done.   The legs are long, perfect for me, kept my ankles from getting cold.  The drawstring was a pain in the butt until I figured it out - I cut the end and Now tie it depending on if I tuck in my baselayer.   I highly recommend, worth the $$
review.name: Absolutely awesome!

name: Solano Chamois Tights - Women's

review.reviewBody: Jacket fits beautifully except the sleeve is slightly large. Love the look of the jacket.
review.name: Waterproof Jacket

review.reviewBody: Works great. I'm short so it hits at the right spot.
review.name: Good raincoat.

review.reviewBody: Purchased this rain coat to replace one that had Velcro along the zipper that kept snagging my clothes. Love my new coat, no Velcro and really nice material, also you can adjust the hood so it stays in place. I bought black, size large because I wanted it loose. I'm 5'1, 122lbs. Wish it came in more colors because the blue, purple and white are too girly imo so it's why I went with black.
review.name: Definitely buy it!

review.reviewBody: Nice design overall. The difference between L and XL is obvious, especially around the shoulder parts. Large one has a perfect fit in the body but narrow on shoulders, XL has a roomy fit in both body I like and roomier on shoulders I don't.
review.name: I like the design and color in black with a black logo

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Great quality waterproof jacket. Packable and stylish. Perfect for my upcoming European hiking and touring trip.
review.name: I would buy this product again

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Good length, not too short. Great thickness and easily fits layers underneath!
review.name: Perfect hiking jacket!

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Fits great and is very flattering with the drawstring waist.
review.name: Love this jacket

review.reviewBody: Awesome jacket.  A great piece to add to your wardrobe.
review.name: This jacket is great.   Quality fabric, durable

review.reviewBody: I love the stretch down jackets.  The black one was my most recent, I have a green and blue one. I just wish they were a little longer!
review.name: Love it!

review.reviewBody:
This jacket is warm and comfortable. So far I’ve only used it for walking the dogs but it will be put to the test fat biking, and skiing.
I ordered a small and feel like it runs on the big side compared to some of my other insulated MH jackets.
review.name: Great jacket!!

review.reviewBody: Comfortable jacket it fits great and it keeps me warm.
review.name: Comfortable and warm

review.reviewBody: My previous stretch down hoodie had a very durable stretchy fabric and much more down filling. It was "true to size". I wore it hard for quite a few years years. This version is very disappointing, I agree with other 2 star reviewers. The fabric is thin, the coat is large and boxy, and there is not much down insulation. I plan to return it asap, but mountain hardware will not allow me to use another carrier during the Can Post strike.
review.name: Too large and lightweight

review.reviewBody: The previous version of this jacket fit true to size, was rugged, stretchy and had significantly more fill. This jacket was too big, the fabric was thinner and the fill was very lightweight.
review.name: Did not meet expectations

review.reviewBody: I placed my order on 10/16/24. Fedex delivered my jacket to the wrong address on 10/22/24. I an email from Fedex that my package was lost on 10/25/2024. I immediately contacted Backcountry and forwarded Fedex email to them. After chatting to backcountry multiples times, I still have not received any update nor refund.
review.name: never received the product
comment: We are sorry to hear that your jacket was delivered to the wrong address and subsequently lost. We understand your frustration with the lack of updates and have sent you an email to discuss this further.

review.reviewBody: Love it!! So warm and very flattering. I love how thin it feels yet it keeps me warmer than most of my thicker coats. Very happy with my purchase!
review.name: New favorite jacket!

review.reviewBody: I LOVE this down hoody! I had another reputable brand puffy and it fit so weird compared to this one. The length of the torso and the arms was perfect! I have very long arms and it fit great! The only reason it isn’t getting 5 stars is because mountain hardware is not making plus sizes anymore. There are so many people who live in larger bodies who love the outdoors and need access to clothes that are comfortable and that are intended for the sport/outdoors. You are limiting a huge population of people by not having extended sizes anymore! Bring back plus sizes!!!!
review.name: Amazing puff hoody that I won’t be able to replace because they don’t carry my size anymore

review.reviewBody: I love everything about this jacket! It has a great fit, looks good outdoors and in the city, is lightweight, and has sturdy zippers. However, the down has traveled over time so now there's no down left around the shoulders, and I mean none. I've shaken it, hung it upside down, all to no avail. Unfortunately, the jacket is now useless which is a shame, as I really loved it!
review.name: No down in shoulder area

name: Stretchdown Hooded Jacket - Women's

review.reviewBody: I bought this pant for bushwack-nordic skiing, snowshoeing, and winter chores. It is a very well made pant. The multiple pockets are great. The vents are super. It fits true to size and looks good. The material is a bit stiffer than I might have anticipated, but it is still very comfortable doing activities. The bummer is the diameter of the ankle opening. Based on the description, and that the ankle can be slim or it can be opened up, I was hoping it would fit over alpine boots. It only just barely can make it over the top. It fits nicely over hiking boots.
review.name: Solid construction

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I have been serially disappointed by Icebreaker of late. I have returned the last 3 products I purchased from Icebreaker to just put things in perspective. But this is a truly outstanding piece. Its feel, thickness, cut and finish not to mention warmth are simply perfect! Only issue is the fact it's a lint magnet. I'd buy a couple of more of these in case the quality goes south just like all the other products over the years.

review.reviewBody:
I bought this over three years ago and love it.
I wear it constantly inside and outside under a wind proof
 layer.  It does need to have a collared shirt worn under otherwise 
would be itchy but that adds to the warmth. 
 I've saved a lot on heating bills and like that it is mostly made of natural fabrics.
The only thing I don't like is that the pretty gold designs
 started to unravel at the elbows and as they are connected
 I can't see how to mend the small holes that are starting to appear
Still I'd get it again as nothing else is as warm and comfortable.
review.name: Super Warm and Looks Good

review.reviewBody: I bought this because I wanted more natural fibers in my wardrobe and I owned it for about a year - pros were that it was warm and cozy, and I received so many compliments on it! The cons were that the yarn was indeed scratchy - something I could get past for real wool - and the weave was quite loose, so much so that the yarn started to wear under the armpits and turning into holes. If I were a more talented seamstress, I would have mended it, but honestly, for the price and the brand, it should have been better quality - I had really expected to have this piece for a lot longer. Please make it with a tighter, more durable weave, and I might buy another one to replace the old one.
review.name: Pretty but doesn’t hold up against wear and tear

review.reviewBody: Not soft, as the other reviewers have noted. However, it’s beautiful and very warm! It also has a nice shape. Love it and would buy another.
review.name: Beautiful!

review.reviewBody:
I got given this two years ago, and love it, I’ve worn it a lot. I find it comfortable and a good shape. 

It’s now got a hole in the elbow, it’s weak there and I’m not sure fixing it will last long/ be comfortable. I want to get another one, but am disappointed it says it’s for a lifetime.
review.name: Comfortable and a good shape

review.reviewBody: I bought this last year for a Christmas present to myself. I have only worn it once because the wool is not soft and cozy. It is uncomfortable. II have several other items from Fjällräven that I adore and would give 5 stars too. This sweater is the only dud.
review.name: Not soft and cozy

review.reviewBody:
I purchased the dark blue sweater in size M. This sweater in real life is even prettier than it appears in the pictures. It fits perfectly and looks very flattering on me.
Very warm an cozy, looking forward colder weather so I can snug into my new cozy item.
review.name: In love with this sweater

review.reviewBody: I had been considering the Ovik cardigan or sweater for a while and finally purchased the cardigan.  The styling is just beautiful and I adore it.  I do wish the cardigan had the elbow patches like the sweater does.  Unfortunately the cardigan just did not have a good fit for me and the wool was of the scratchy variety.  The top seems too roomy and the waist was perfect.  It almost felt/looked top heavy?  Because the material is so scratchy I did not like that the collar is hard to keep down.  It may have been better if it had been lined.  The other thing I did not care for was how loose the weave was.  If held up to light you can see right through it and I was looking for something a little warmer and substantial.  This material will snag very easily and will require gentle care.  Sadly this was returned.
review.name: Amazing aesthetic but scratchy

name: Ovik Knit Cardigan - Women's

review.reviewBody: These Deceptr pants are great. Very light, stretches with all your moves. I like tampered fit pants and these a just great. Not too skinny. The waist band is stretchy also which if you in between sizes is a great plus. Extremely comfortable. I use for everyday pant; they look too nice to hike in. Very pleased.
review.name: Love Kuhl Products

review.reviewBody:
Love the pants
They are comfortable and versatile for outdoors or office 
Beware that the colors shown online are not even close to the actual colors of the pants so be prepared to send many of these back because they are not the color you thought you were buying
review.name: Deceptor pants

review.reviewBody: I have now purchased two pair of these. The pants have a stretch in the waist area that feels very comfortable. The build quality is excellent. In warmer weather the fabric stayed "cool". I only wish that the length was a half size longer (31).  Surprisingly look good going out perhaps more so than for rugged activity.
review.name: Glad I bought these pants

review.reviewBody: I wear long pants even on hot days to protect my legs from brush and vines playing disc golf. These pants stay nice and cool but they snag easy.
review.name: Great pants but delicate fabric.

review.reviewBody: I like the pants and the waist is fine but the inseam is short. The stated inseam is 32" but fits short and measures only 30", a big discrepancy. Unfortunately couldn't find a 34" inseam to try.
review.name: Nice pants but not true to size

name: Deceptr 2.0 Pant - Men's

review.reviewBody: Jacket has multiple stains on it. In its current form it isn’t wearable. This jacket has clearly been worn by another person. The stain is very obvious right on the front of the jacket. I’m giving this score because someone knowingly charged me for a defective product.
review.name: Jacket arrived w/ multiple stains in it

review.reviewBody: Love the waterproof material on the shoulders!  The amethyst color is prettier in real life than in the online photos.  I am 5'4 110 lb and the Small is a good size for me.  I just wish they made all features shorter/smaller (like the elastic on the cuffs, the drawstring around the waist, and the rim of the hood.  I also wish there was a chest inside zip pocket for a phone (I use my outside chest pocket for sunglasses).  A drawstring around the rim of the hood would be nice too.  I love the dark color for not showing the dirt and keeping the jacket looking nice and new.
review.name: Mostly love it

review.reviewBody: The jacket fits true to size and is very warm. I love the hood for snowy days.
review.name: Warm and cozy

review.reviewBody: The zipper is better than the ghost, but the weight and warmth is not as described. Will return and get another one that is closer to the weight described.
review.name: Not weighed as described.

review.reviewBody: Perfect weight for cold (not frigid) days.  Easy to move in, very comfortable.  Purchased for my 11 year old and the S fits her well (slightly big, on purpose).  It also fits me but is snug at the hips (I am size 6/28 in jeans).
review.name: Great, movable, warm jacket

review.reviewBody: I did tons of research on light puffers before deciding to purchase this hoodie. I've had it for a few weeks now, and I'm obsessed with it. Perfect fit, surprisingly warm. I got it in Saffron, and people are constantly telling me they love it and asking me where I got it.
review.name: Perfect!

review.reviewBody: This jacket is warm but light at the same time. No heavy parka. I can wear it in a store without sweating. It’s just about perfect for dry days well into the low 20s. I usually have to pull out my parka, not in happy with this one.
review.name: Warm but light

review.reviewBody: I love my new coat.  It is warm, lightweight and functional.  I love the hood and the bright yellow color.
review.name: Great jacket

review.reviewBody: Love the jacket and how light it is. The color is also super pretty. I got the silver one and surprised it’s actually not see through. I’ll be taking it to do EBC next year so hoping for it to keep me warm.
review.name: The Silver is gorgeous!

review.reviewBody: I'm surprised about how warm it is without being too puffy. Very comfortable with useful pockets. Just be aware that Saffron color is kinda transparent so you can see some dark coloured feathers behind the fabric, and that ended up looking like little stains.
review.name: Awesome, I will buy again.

hasVariant.description: Buy the Weston Backwoods Splitboard - 2025 online or shop all Snowboard from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: The Backwoods split is an all-time favorite for me. This board surfs pow with so much play and nimbleness. The directional taper allows me to ride a 152 with a pack and not have to worry about sinking my 5'6" 160lb self. The only area that it isn't utterly perfect in is the chunderiest of snow in which case I like the one step stiffer of the Ridgeline.
review.name: Does it all

review.reviewBody: I debated 157 vs 160. Eventually I went 160 and happy I did. I test rode this board at my local lift accessed resort. The size was perfect. This board rides smaller than it is. My other solid boards are 152 (volume shifted), 158 (twin) and 159 (freeride). I was concerned the 160 would be too large. Not the case. This board handles so well and seems to have the best attributes of my other boards all in one (float, nimbleness, edge hold and changeability through crud). Looking forward to taking this in the backcountry once I have my skills and safety education complete.
review.name: 160 Backwoods for 162 lbs, Size 10 dude.

review.reviewBody:
As the title says, the Weston Backwoods is THE splitboard for tight New England glades. The Backwoods loves making tight turns, darting between birch trees all the while the large nose keeps you floating above the pow! The short tail is perfect for slipping around trees as you hammer through the glades and the rugged polyamid top sheet keeps snow from sticking.  
When your legs are too burnt to make short tight, turns, pop out onto the trail and lay beautiful arching turns in the corduroy! And don’t worry, there’s plenty of camber underfoot for when things are less powdery!
review.name: Excels at Gnarth East Trees

review.reviewBody: This board definitely has a pow board DNA with the rocker wide nose but it really hold its own everywhere on the mountain. I'm able to get it edge to edge really easily in very tight trees (which is often the case in the PNW). But it's rigid and damp enough to high speeds. When I travel for touring, I definitely have powder in mind but conditions can't be controlled. So it's so great to have the Backwoods so I know it will be great for ideal soft snow conditions but still super capable if snow isn't piling up.
review.name: Pow Shape but More

review.reviewBody: The perfect go-to ride for any situation. This is a pow centric board that won't let you down in variable or poor conditions. I like to think of it as the one board does it all kind of ride, a true quiver killer! Between its performance and durability makes for an extremely reliable ride! from trees to steeps from ice to pow it gets the job done. definitely the go to choice regardless of conditions!
review.name: Swiss army split!

review.reviewBody: This board really can do it all. From ripping big open faces, to surfing tight trees, to bottomless face shots this board feels right at home. The directional set up feels super surfy and turns on a dime. While in big terrain it feels great just opening it up. You can score pow turns in the northern aspects then rip corn in the south all in the same day feels like this board is just made for it. When I'm not sure what the conditions are going to be I’m pulling the Backwoods off the shelf (also most days when I do know what the conditions are).
review.name: Does It All

review.reviewBody: This is the board you want. Lightweight, durable, and an absolute blast to ride. I have used this board in a variety of conditions and terrain, and have yet to be disappointed. Long runs down volcanos, back-to-back gladed laps, open bowls, technical lines, and even the variable! Truly love this thing.
review.name: What an incredible board!

name: Backwoods Splitboard - 2025

hasVariant.description: Buy the Oakley Sutro Prizm Sunglasses online or shop all Accessories from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody:
At first I was worried that the lack of unobtainium grippers on the temples would be an issue with stability, but after a couple hundred miles of rides in hot and sweaty conditions, I can say these haven’t budged!  In fairness, I have worn these under the helmet straps vs. over like I do with other sunglasses, but I’m confident that isn’t a requirement.

The lens quality and visual acuity, as with any other Oakley sunglasses I’ve ever owned is second to none.  The lenses do a terrific job of cutting down on light and glare, while making sure the things I want to see absolutely POP.  For context, I ordered the pair with the Prizm Road lenses for…yeah…road riding.  Additionally, these are very large, which in my mind is a great thing.  I have great protection from wind and debris, there is zero interruption to my peripheral vision.  Other frames (I’m looking at you, Jawbreakers) have frame elements that get in the way and can make it challenging to see, particularly if you’re taking a quick glance over your shoulder.  That is absolutely not the case here.

The one complaint I have is that for some reason I have had far more sweat pool and collect on the inside of the lenses to the Sutros than any other pair of sunglasses I have, regardless of brand.  I can’t tell if this is because of how close they sit to my face, shape of the lens, or perhaps the lack of vents.  In any case, I have to consciously avoid having my head tilted down too far lest I get so much sweat on my glasses that I can’t see.
review.name: Expected Oakley Quality

review.reviewBody: I have a pretty wide face and the fit of these is great.  Coverage on face means you see no edges and forget you have them on.
review.name: Love these glasses

review.reviewBody:
I'd been in the market for some running and biking glasses and came across the Sutros. I was a little bit hesitant at first because they seemed like they might fog up in certain conditions, but up to this point I haven't had any issues. They came in a high-quality hard case, with a microfiber bag as well, which is nice for when I need to chuck them in my bag for travel! I've put in a bunch of miles running in them and haven't had any issues with them. They don't bounce or slide off of my face like some of my other glasses would while running or Mountain Biking. They also fit really great with my Bike helmet, which is a plus!

The Prizm Trail lens does a great job of providing contrast and keeping my eyes from straining. As long as they fit well with your helmet, I'd highly recommend these for running and/or biking! The lens is pretty large, so if you have a smaller face or prefer smaller lenses then I'd look into the Sutro S!
review.name: Run/Bike Go-to!

review.reviewBody: Great to see a USA Olympic version.  I was a bit concerned not having vents would make them fog on rides.  No issues after a few rides.
review.name: Love'em

review.reviewBody:
This glasses are perfect.  I wear for cycling and running.  Having the Oakley Prizm technology not only helps me see well in sunny Colorado, but as a road cyclist the reflective lens lets drivers see me a little better and that is always worth it.  Oakley's always have a perfect mix of comfort and security on my pretty average round head.  These have quickly become my go to for all things outdoors.

Plus I think I look really good wearing them.
review.name: Couldn't ask for better Shades

review.reviewBody: Bought these for road cycling, to add some style, and end up wearing all the time. The over-sized lens is covers the whole eyes area completely with clear visibility. The Prizim lens are my fav. from Oakley.
review.name: The best of it kind! Great for cycling

review.reviewBody:
They?re great but I had to return them because apparently I?m allergic to the unobtanium nose piece. 

The lenses are amazing for the record.
review.name: I?d love these for cycling/ hiking
comment: What do you mean by unobtanium nose piece? Thought it was a toxic material, so I looked it up and still don't see how it fits into describing the nose piece. Just curious.

review.reviewBody: Bought the vented sutros and love the size, look and coverage for cycling and trail running. Unfortunately, the vents are directly in your line of sight when riding (especially climbing) really distorting my vision. Will keep for running and Nordic skiing but they get ???? For cycling.
review.name: Vents are a bad idea
comment: I totally agree. They impacted field of vision and did not work out when going fast. I now only use the vented lens (origins collection) for XC/ski touring and they work great for that.

name: Sutro Prizm Sunglasses

review.reviewBody: I love these pants. They are very comfortable and have a perfect fit. I love low sitting pants and these are perfect. I am 5. 8” and my weight is 128 I ordered the 2. I have 3 jeans of the samen design and they are 4 .
review.name: I love these pants. They

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] These are just what I was looking for! The comfort of the Carson jean but with the ability to dress up a little more if needed. They are a little lighter-weight than I was expecting, but I prefer that to pants that weigh me down. I wear either a size 4 or 6 in the jean version, depending on how relaxed I want the fit, and I got these in a 6, which I think was a good choice. I'm not sure if they will stretch out as much during a day of wearing.
review.name: Great pants!

review.reviewBody: I was optimistic about these cords because I love the fit of Carson jeans. However the color was really different than in the photo (looked brown but really a dark green) and they were also super thin. I could have lived with the thinness if I liked the color enough, but I ended up sending them back.
review.name: Ok, but

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Great fit, nice colors, material feels good. But, material is extremely thin and I wonder about durability.
review.name: Great fit, nice colors, material

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] These jeans felt like butter from the first wear! Love, love, love them
review.name: so comfortable you could sleep in them

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I really wanted to like these cords; however, the weight was a little too thin and not really cord material. The length and slate color were perfect, but the overall fit of these cords wasn't the same as the Carson's Jeans that I love so much, so I had to return this item.
review.name: I really wanted to like

review.reviewBody: A light pair of corduroys. The color isn't my favorite, they are a little more shiny than I expected, but are very comfortable. They also stretch more than I expected, but I think I'd still order the same size.
review.name: Comfortable and light

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I have the Carson fit jeans and love love love them so I knew the cords would be a winner too. I love the straight not too tight fit. And the material is soft and will only get softer. I got the birch color and really like that as well. I was expecting it to be like a winter white but it has a browner tone that I really like.
review.name: Comfy cords

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Love the look and the colors. I have a straight narrow hip build and these are little too loose in the upper leg hip area. I wish they were a straighter cut.
review.name: Cute pant- better for someone with a little curvier build

review.reviewBody: These run a bit big but that makes them so comfy. Love the color and quality. Will order in another color.
review.name: These run a bit big

name: Carson Cord Pant - Women's

review.itemreviewed: Quilted Boyfriend Plaid Shirt Jacket - Women's
review.reviewBody: I love it! It's a boxy comfortable jacket with wider sleeves that I can comfortably wear a flannel or hoodie underneath.  Great for cool days with a t-shirt too!  Washes up nice.  It's been through the washer about 3x now (kids and yard work) and still wears like new.  I'm a huge fan of this jacket!
review.name: Love this jacket

review.itemreviewed: Quilted Boyfriend Plaid Shirt Jacket - Women's
review.reviewBody: I bought a quilted plaid jacket last season and it was wayyy higher quality, the inside had high quality fabric, stitching and weight to it. Now this new quilted plaid jacket has completely different material, no extra stitching on the inside of the jacket, a weird fabric that makes a weird noise, lighter overall. It’s still cute, but with the huge drop in quality I had to return it.
review.name: Quality has gotten worse

review.itemreviewed: Quilted Boyfriend Plaid Shirt Jacket - Women's
review.reviewBody: Easy to wear and comfortable.  Washed & dried (low heat) numerous times, over all it soften-up, did not shrink a bunch, sleeve length is good too.  Looks great with everything. Happy with this purchase.  Would love to buy the other color now:)
review.name: Grab and Go Jacket

review.itemreviewed: Quilted Boyfriend Plaid Shirt Jacket - Women's
review.reviewBody: This was poor quality.  I always wear a medium however this was huge around me and sleeves are too short--mislead by review.
review.name: Not super cute

review.itemreviewed: Quilted Boyfriend Plaid Shirt Jacket - Women's
review.reviewBody: I ordered this in the yellow color and I LOVE it. The fit is super cute and cozy, and goes great with any of my shoulder season outfits. Right now, I mainly use it at my desk in the office bc the AC is insane and much colder inside than outside. I'm not usually a plaid jacket person, but this yellow is so good - I can't wait to take it camping as the temps start to drop.
review.name: Favorite Jacket

name: Quilted Boyfriend Plaid Shirt Jacket - Women's

hasVariant.name: Katana Lace Climbing Shoe - Women's
hasVariant.description: Buy the La Sportiva Katana Lace Climbing Shoe - Women's online or shop all Climb from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: My son started wearing this at 13yrs old, and he has narrow feet. This was the perfect 'leveling up' from the Red Chili Puzzle shoe, which trained him to wear a more advanced shoe and keep the curl in his foot/toes. It's got a great heel fit if you have slender ankles and soft fabric cushion on top. Some may not like that. The fabric will absorb sweat, and you can pull out odor by shoving crumpled newspaper balls into the shoe for a day. Lastly, I agree with other people who suggest sizing down by 0.5, or 1 for some - but beware they are very stiff out of the box and will hurt to get your feet in, so give 1-2 weeks to break them in. We kept the same size because my son's feet are still growing and they were comfy right out of the box, with the stiff toe area still usable, and he still has room to grow into it.
review.name: excellent for teen boy with slender feet

review.reviewBody: Awesome climbing shoes! Recommend to buy 1.5 less than your normal size shoe.
review.name: Great!

review.reviewBody: I generally wear a 39.5 mens Katana (old model), 39.5 women's solution. 40 TC pro and they all perform great out of the box. I purchased the new women's katana in a 39.5 and they feel super comfortable but a bit clunky. They would be great for all day/all around use but when it comes to honing in on small edges it feels like I'm closing my eyes and praying that my feet don't pop off. This is similar to what my tc pros (40) feel like when I'm edging.  I think the new katanas may run a 1/4 to 1/2 size large. A friend of mine had the same experience with the new mens katana and ended up buying a 1/2 size down to compensate and is satisfied. I will be exchanging mine for a size down and will report back.
review.name: Size issues.

review.reviewBody: I decided to purchase these bc I couldn't find my size (42) in the men's version anywhere and I was utterly jubilated to find out that these are just as good (if not better). They're a bit softer than the regular Katana Lace and the fit of the new models is about a half size larger than the old ones. If you're a 42.5 in the old shoe than get a 42 or 41.5 -- you won't regret it.
review.name: Women's Katanas are great for men too

name: Katana Lace Climbing Shoe - Women's

review.itemreviewed: FR-C Pro Lightweight UPF 50+ Long-Sleeve Jersey - Men's
review.reviewBody:
Really like this jersey and going to buy another. It's great for spring rides or summer mornings. For me, it takes the edge of when riding in the 60s F. It keeps the sun off, without getting to hot into the low 80s F.

Sizing tends to run small, similar to the other Girordana kit I've tried. I generally go up one size compared to American brands. 

The fit works for me. Not a lot of extra fabric and doesn't flap while riding. However, it's not clinging or restrictive.
review.name: My Favorite Jersey

review.itemreviewed: FR-C Pro Lightweight UPF 50+ Long-Sleeve Jersey - Men's
review.reviewBody: I am 5' 11", 165 pounds.  The only exercise I get is biking and swimming and I'm not buff, but my arms don't fit in the armholes.  It fit great in every other dimension.  Too bad because aside from the armholes, I liked it.
review.name: Great if you're skinny enough

review.reviewBody: Great quality. We own 5 pairs of Sunskis. These are the only sunglasses we wear
review.name: Light weight and fits great

review.reviewBody: The glasses are as advertised. They are comfortable and work great.
