review.reviewBody: These fit perfectly and look great. The virtual try on is the best. This is my fourth pair of Sunskis and the try on feature has been accurate each time. Great, classic style and sun protection.
review.name: Style and sun protection

review.reviewBody: They are nice oversized frames w perfectly tinted lenses.
review.name: Stylish shades

review.reviewBody: I originally bought my first pair of Sunski shades I think like 6-7 years ago on Zappos.  Loved the pair, but I have to admit I did not treat them well.  I put that pair of shades through so much abuse and they didn't get a scratch on them.  Dropped them many timers, and still they wiped clean.  UNTIL... I actually dropped the pair into my TOOL bag, left them for a week and then found them while I was digging for tools.  Two small scratches appeared on the lenses.  Amazingly durable pair.  Headlands Grey black.  Ill buy that pair again.  Ray Bans scratch if you look at them wrong.  These are trully lifetime shades if you simply keep them out of tool bags.
review.name: so durable.

review.reviewBody: These are my second set of sunglasses and I love them. I’ve worn them hiking, at the beach, playing golf and for everyday use and they are outstanding.
review.name: Great sunglasses from a great company

review.reviewBody: Been wearing these forever. They are comfy, lightweight, and give me a clear view of the volleyball court. My only complaint is that you dropped the fun lense colors, like purple and green and red. I wish you'd bring the fun back!
review.name: Good on everyone! Need brighter lense colors tho

review.reviewBody: Love them! Have several pairs. A customer since 2016.
review.name: Love them-wear ever day:)

review.reviewBody: These glasses look nice and fit well but if you’re an active person be careful with them. Mine lasted a week before I had a big scratch on them that was  too obvious to wear.
review.name: Nice but scratch easily

description: Buy the HOKA Torrent 2 Trail Running Shoe - Men's online or shop all Footwear from Backcountry.com.

hasVariant.name: Torrent 2 Trail Running Shoe - Men's
hasVariant.description: Buy the HOKA Torrent 2 Trail Running Shoe - Men's online or shop all Footwear from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: I like this shoe's fit, stability, and light weight. It is my second pair. I have normal width feet and wear either size US 13 or 14 depending on brand; for these 13 is the right size. What I don't like is that the soles consistently delaminated on both pairs I've owned well before anything else wore. I've run in them a handful of times, mostly using them casually. I've had to shoe-goo both soles back on in multiple places. They should be built better. Use stronger glue!
review.name: More shoe-goo than sole

review.reviewBody: I have purchased other models from Hoka and they seem too narrow except Torrent 2
review.name: Torrent 2 works for me

review.reviewBody: I've been so happy with Hoka shoes and sandal. It has literally fixed my plantar fasciitis pain in my foot. I appreciate my shoes with every step I take. :-)
review.name: These are my 3rd and 4th Hoka purchase!

review.reviewBody: Shoe fits perfectly, looks good, great support. Excellent other trail
review.name: Excellent Choice

review.reviewBody: No regrets I wish I had bought more than one pair
review.name: Great product

review.reviewBody: This is my second pair of Hoka shoes. I am more pleased with thtis pair than I was with the 1st pair. That's saying a lot, cause I loved the 1st pair.
review.name: Awesome!!

review.reviewBody: I was not happy with the shoes. For how much I paid for them. They should have been better. The first pair hurt my feet, and the second pair fell like I was walking on rocks I was not impressed.
review.name: Not happy

review.reviewBody: Super light, super comfy, stylin' - about to order a second pair ASAP!
review.name: Can't decide what's better - the look or the feel!

review.reviewBody: These shoes are comfortable, strudy, and provide good traction. They do the job for the light trail hiking that I do on a daily basis. My only concern with these particular shoes is that they do not seem to allow my feet to breathe enough. The ventilation in the upper is minimal and traps the heat in the shoe too much. Maybe they were designed this way for more waterproofing, I am not sure. I have only worn these in cold weather so far and would probably not use them in summer months or for long hikes. I have also not tried them on wet, slippery rocks yet, but the soles seem to be able to handle that.
review.name: Decent shoe. Needs better ventilation

review.reviewBody: I am a junior high PE teacher who is on his feet all day and the Torrent 2s help take care of my feet and back allowing me to make it through a busy day.
review.name: These shoes are absolutely wonderful.

name: Torrent 2 Trail Running Shoe - Men's

review.reviewBody: I was replacing a previous Mission XL that fit perfectly. I ordered this new Mission XL and it is smaller and fits very snug. I cannot wear it.
review.name: Same size much smaller

review.reviewBody: Helmet fits great, excellent safety features, love the color and looks fantastic
review.name: Excellent buy

review.reviewBody: It arrived with a big chunk of non-removable glue in front. The ear pads are challenging to remove, posing a risk of breakage in the process. While the foam inside the ear pads should be easily removable for replacing it with a helmet speaker, it was mistakenly glued and proved difficult to remove. Additionally, the helmet did not come with a bag, contrary to what was mentioned in the description video, which stated that the Mission comes with a Smith helmet bag.
review.name: Many Issues

review.reviewBody: The helmet fits great. It keeps my head pretty warm on cold days too without having to wear any beanie cap underneath. I have Smith goggles that fit the helmet good BUT, the goggles slide out of the goggle keeper in the back of the helmet all the time. I dropped my goggles more than once this season when wearing them up on the helmet. I have never had this happen before so I think I got a bad one on my helmet honestly. So, I would give 5 stars for the fit, but you get 3 for not so great quality check on the flimsy goggle keeper on the back.
review.name: Almost 5 stars

review.reviewBody: The Smith Mission Helmet save my live on New Years day, when one of my binding failed. The helmet is ruined by my head is not. Thank you for a quality product.
review.name: Great helmet.

review.reviewBody: It’s taking me forever to find instructions so I can put in headphones without ripping the thing to shreds! It’s 2024 - have the manual SOMEWHERE on your website!
review.name: Helmet is great, but no instructions online

review.reviewBody: I recently used a different Smith M size helmet and fitted perfectly, so I decided to order online the Mission helmet M size, my head circumference is 57.5cm, so I according to the size chart I should be an M. But unfortunately I can feel a lot of pressure in my head just because this runs small.
review.name: Small and not very comfortable

review.reviewBody: The helmet works as intended, but it's a bit bulky for backcountry purposes (it's tight under my backpack. Additionally, the Goggle Clip is flimsy. It seems to loosen up very easily. I accidentally clipped my backpack into it, and it's now all floppy.
review.name: Good Helmet, but Goggle Clip Flimsy

review.reviewBody: Great helmet! Warm, comfortable, good ratcheting system for the head band. The vent adjustment is good. The chin strap is comfortable. Highly recommend for the price!
review.name: Great helmet! Warm, comfortable, good

review.reviewBody: Bought this helmet for my accident prone daughter. She loved it, got the size medium. She is 6 feet tall and her head measured almost 59 cm. I decided not to size up to a large, and that was the right call.
review.name: Great fit!

name: Mission Helmet

My only complaint with the 2nd pair is the power strap buckle. For some unknown reason the hook opening is facing up so the strap falls out when skinning. Why is this a problem? It catches on hobblebush when it hangs down after coming unhooked. I don't like the top two buckles or power strap tight when in climbing mode. review.reviewBody: Great knee pad with better protection at the cost of a little less comfort than the older dakine slayer pads. Worthy purchase!
review.name: Great knee pad!

review.reviewBody: Not sure how these are adult unisex knee pads. I'm a small person: 5'1" and 115lbs with normal athletic legs so I thought the size small would fit but they are ridiculously small. Like for children with stick legs. I barely got them on my lower leg and definitely couldn't pull them over my knee. I had to get help to pull them off. I had ordered a size medium as well just in case and these weren't much bigger. I could get the size medium  over my knee but it was a struggle and the pad itself was so hard and uncomfortable. The lower part dug into my shin. I felt like if I were to crash with these they'd do more damage than good. Super bummed these didn't work out. Just crazy a small person like myself would have to go with a size large in order for them to fit. But they are so uncomfortable I'm just going to go with a different knee pad.  I even checked the tags to make sure they weren't youth size or something. Tags say adult unisex.
review.name: Too small

review.reviewBody: Great lightweight summer layer for wind/rain - exactly what I was looking for. It's a pretty slim fit. I went with my usual xs in Patagonia and I can fit a tank or slim tee underneath, but not much else. This works for me since I wanted something for hot weather, but definitely size up if you plan to layer over anything heavier. So far, it's held up well in light rain and doesn't trap heat, but I'm not sure I'd trust the water protection in a heavy downpour.
review.name: Ultra Lightweight

review.reviewBody: Packs down to pocket size, runs a bit tighter around the torso than original Houdini jacket. Would NOT be good over thick layers.
review.name: Packs down to a pocket size.

review.reviewBody: The one I bought is a different one as the picture, but anyway the color is a little darker than pictured, really want to return it but the shipping back is not free.
review.name: not as pictured

review.reviewBody: This is my 2nd. Houdini jacket. It weighs less than an ounce, yet protects from wind quite well. Very flattering fit, on me it's a tad longer than on the model. (5'4", 120 lbs.) Last time I purchased one size up to fit fleece inside, this will be for more hotter hiking with wind at 10,000 ft. mode. The prints are great and this jacket will double as a nice shirt apres-hike!
review.name: Can't beat the weight!!

review.reviewBody:
Descriptions were accurate, especially colors and sizes. I use my Houdini jacket nine months out of a year. It washed as well, hang dry as recommend.
Backcountry is my first go-to store for all my adventures. I especially love that they have a large selection of brands, including their genetic brand. Online order and return were super easy! They have quality product at great prices. Easy to find sizes and colors that I wanted. Their prices are unbeatable, especially their sale events.  I highly recommend Backcountry for your next adventures.
review.name: Great gears at great prices!

review.reviewBody: I bought this jacket after eying it on my cycling teammate all fall and winter. Perfect layer for the wind and light precipitation.  And Backcountry perks helped pay for half. 😉
review.name: Wonderful!

review.reviewBody: I ordered this jacket over a month ago and never received it so I can’t review it.  I received a pair of hiking shoes instead.  Wonder what’s going on with Backcountry.  It’s been a nightmare trying to get my order.
review.name: Never received it

review.reviewBody: Am always fan of Patagonia products and this is all as it was described when I ordered it. Somehow, I guess I missed that there are no pockets which keeps it nicely fitted, close to the body. However, had I realized that there were no pockets, probably would not have ordered it. But I did keep it.
review.name: Nice Light Weight Jacket

review.reviewBody: Just got this to prep for rainy and windy Seattle fall runs. Love how lightweight and portable it is. I'm almost wishing for it to start raining here. Almost.
review.name: Ready for Fall Running

review.reviewBody:
I absolutely love my Houdinis (yes, plural). I use it for biking, running, fighting the Pacific wind and sometimes also the sun.
It makes picking the right wardrobe so easy: Jersey/shirt + houdini works in the winter and in the summer.
If you area outdoorsy person you definitely want to have one (or two,...).
review.name: Everyone needs at least one Houdini
